text: Abe Judge Clark (1894-1973) was an Australian rugby league footballer who played in the 1920s.Whiticker/Hudson "The Encyclopedia Of Rugby League Players (1995 Edition) () ==Career== Clark was a foundation player in the very first year that the St. George club featured in the NSWRFL in 1921. He played predominantly in Reserve Grade during his career. He was later on the general football club committee at St. George, and was later the official representative from the St. George DRLFC to sit on the NSWRFL Junior League. Abe also played at St. George with his younger brother Jack Clark. Abe came from a sporting family. An elder brother Harry Clark played for the Western Suburbs (1913-1914) and South Sydney in 1916. Another brother Jack, was a successful welterweight boxer at the Newtown Olympia. LABOR DAILY (Sydney) 4th Oct 1929 'Abe Clark' reference https://trove.nla.gov.au/newspaper/article/239780990?searchTerm=%22abe%20clarke%22%20st.george%20juniors&searchLimits;=l-state=New+South+Wales# ==War service== Clark enlisted in the AIF in 1915. He survived the War and returned to Australia in 1917. AIF Project: Abe Judge Clark. https://www.aif.adfa.edu.au/showPerson?pid=53091 Clark died on 15 June 1973 at Kogarah, New South Wales.Sydney Morning Herald: Death Notice 16 June 1973 ==References== Category:St. George Dragons players Category:1894 births Category:1973 deaths Category:Australian military personnel of World War I Category:Australian rugby league players Category:Rugby league players from Sydney Category:Rugby league second-rows
title: Abe Clark
